page.title: 04A WHALSAY WEDDING 1/2
page.content: A Whalsay wedding is always interesting.After the marriage ceremony at the church the guests,up to 800 invited from on the isle,go to the public hall.There the Whalsay band play.The 10 or more men of the band take turns to play.The adults always dance but children dance in the Boston 2 step,St Bernard's Waltz,and Gay Gordons.Other dances include the Eightsome Reel,Lancers and Quadrille. There is a cookhouse where about 8 men cut up perhaps 12 sheep which are then cooked in great big pots over an open peat fire.The pots of mutton are taken to the hall for the guests to eat.Supper is served in a side-room,up to 8 sittings needed.With the mutton are served bannocks(made of flour, water,salt and baking soda) which are dipped in the mutton"bro",gravy.Also served are fancies,juice and tea.
